data.name: Let's Talk: Exploring Masculinity
data.description:
Join us for our monthly discussion and support group. 

The purpose of this meet up is to share stories and reflect on issues of masculinity and gender. 

Anyone is welcome here regardless of gender identity. Bring questions or topics you'd like to speak on or propose one to the group. 

Let's listen to each other, talk through our emotions, and challenge our notions of masculinity and gender. Bring a snack (potluck style)!

Ages: 16 and older. 
Location: 3464 W Diversey Ave
Eating: 6:30-7:30pm
Talking: 7:30-9:30pm

This is a sober event, which means there is no drinking or smoking allowed at Hostel Earphoria from 6pm-10pm.

data.name: Hostel Halloween // The 7 Deadly Sins
data.description:
Hear this all ye VAIN, WRATHFUL, GREEDY, LUSTFUL, ENVIOUS, SLOTHFUL and GLUTTONOUS heathens. Hostel requires you to attend & celebrate THE SEVEN DEADLY SINS. 

Bring us your mortal sins, your venal transgressions, your moral trespasses. Join your fellow denizens of Limbo to dance & revel across our seven art installations devoted to our darkest desires and offenses. 
 
where the laughter of despair and delirium mixes 
_ _ _ _ _ｃｏｕｒｔｅｓｙ ｏｆ _ _ _ _ _ 
▲ THE DEN OF AVARICE 
 ° DR. DEATH CRUSH ° Psychic Dominatrix, Shape-shifting She-Devil, Violet backed by her band  
[www.doctordeathcrush.bandcamp.com]
 ° IMELDA MARCOS ° Painting of Skeletal Goats Grinding their Teeth Across The Sky
 [www.imeldamarcos.bandcamp.com]
_ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _
▲ THE BALLROOM OF VANITY
 ° SASHA NO DISCO °  Chicago's premier vintage vinyl vamp pumping disco.
[www.mixcloud.com/LeFreakChicago]
° THE WIFE OF WRATH ° c*nty ballroom tracks for runway divas,bois, face gods & goddesses fusing 90's nostalgia r&b realness
[www.soundcloud.com/lilpettycrocker/sets/the-wife-of-wraths-mixes] 
° BONITA APPLEBLUNT ° Musical alchemist, weaving past & present hip-hop & rap
 [www.soundcloud.com/bonitaappleblunt]

▲ENVY'S CABARET 
▲REALM OF WRATH
▲LUST’S DOMINION
▲SLOTH’S BOUDOIR 
▲THE GLUTTONS’ FEAST- guzzle & gorge while chef Glad creates sumptuous fare and other waist-expanding delicacies.
_ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _

☑ Costumes highly encouraged. 
Take the opportunity to consult the darkest recesses of your imagination on what sinister fiend you secretly desire to be
☑ BYOB 
☑ $7 before 10p / $10 after 10p

*Please respect the space and those in it. You will be asked to leave if you make anyone uncomfortable with your behavior. Thank you for listening and being self-aware.

data.name: Art & Activism: A Chicago Student Action Back To School Bash
data.description:
Come join us at Hostel Earphoria on Saturday, Oct. 6th for a night of performances and open-mic to learn about the Chicago Student Action community and values! Open to all students in the greater Chicago area (and anyone else!) curious about grassroots activism and community organizing.

We'll be featuring performances by local artists, and by anyone who has something to share.

PERFORMERS:
Joshua Virtue

David Ellis
https://soundcloud.com/00davidellis

String Figures 
http://stringfigures.bandcamp.com/
----------------------------------------------------------------------
Contact us if you are planning to come from the Northwestern University campus, or the UChicago campus to see if we can accommodate transportation for you.

Unfortunately this location is not wheelchair accessible (there are about 5 steps to get into the first floor, a few steps down to get into the basement, and steps between the basement and first floor). Please contact us with any other accessibility needs.

data.name: Yardsale Karaoke
data.description:
We will be doing some fall cleaning at Hostel Earphoria, getting rid of old bits and pieces, odds and ends, creating more space and breathing room inside our art space.

Look out for:

Various clothing
Music equip
instrument cases
instruments
knick knacks
maybe artwork
maybe a music desk
so many things
most for cash, some for free

Garden Day will still happen as usual if y'all are interested, but also karaoke in the void and some light snacks and sweet tea.

data.name: The Hostel: Summer Bummer 2018
data.description:
Hostel started our Summer all day fests 6 years ago and we're keeping our favorite summer tradition alive with an amazing lineup of talented artists & comedians. This is just all love, music, art, chill vibes, and a bunch of free food. 
Come Early, Come Hungry, and Hang with us in our garden all day!

data.name: Let's Talk: Exploring Masculinity
data.description:
Join us for our monthly discussion and support group. 

The purpose of this meet up is to share stories and reflect on issues of masculinity and gender. 

You're welcome here. This is a space for men, trans-men, male-presenting people, or anyone who feels like they've benefitted from male privilege. Bring questions or topics you'd like to speak on or propose one to the group if you'd like. 

Let's listen to each other, talk through our emotions, and challenge our notions of masculinity and gender. Bring a snack (potluck style)!

data.name: DojoTV Premiere Party!
data.description:
It's been a minute! but we got a function launching a new project~ @thedojoTV

7PM Doors
8PM Show
Free / Donation~
Location: RutCorp (msg for address)

DojoTV is a grassroots media creating initiative that emerged from Chicago's DIY venue The Dojo.

Drawing inspiration from NPR' Tiny Desk Concert, The Blogotheque, and Chicago's own JBTV, The Dojo's natural progression into media involves live music. The Live Series bi-annually partners with different Chicago art spaces and develops a live performance concept with the artists.

Premiering tonight will be this spring's installment partnered with art-space Earphoria: Chicago featuring screenings of live recordings of 7 artists:

MICHA
michellejrodriguez.com

LuLu Be
soundcloud.com/lulubomb

Sex No Babies
sexnobabies.bandcamp.com

Yomí
thatharpist.com

Melanin
melaninpunk.bandcamp.com/

GoreJizz
http://gorejizz.church/

Kayem with Bassel & The Supernaturals
soundcloud.com/thisiskayem
basselmusic.com/

We will also be premiering a sneak peak of of Stephen Wilkes's new instagram series: Stephen is Concerned.

☞ ☜♡~PERFORMANCES BY~☞ ☜♡

Babykettle
https://babykettle.bandcamp.com/
Pradia 
instagram.com/pradia_music

Comedic & Hosting stylings by Max Thomas & Alex Palma 
Sounds by DJ Sasha NoDisco 
Projection Visuals by: Eli Rivers & Alex Palma

So come by Rutcorp for an evening of video, music, & comedy!

Bring cash for egg nog burritos & a dojoTV T-shirt or other clothing made possible by: Ezequiel Ramos of Latinta Prints & Design

☜♡☞ ☜♡☞ ☜♡☞ ☜♡☞ ☜♡☞ ☜♡☞ ☜♡☞ ☜♡☞ ☜♡☞ ☜♡☞ 

Focused on pushing DIY & underground culture forward, dojoTV aims to amplify marginalized voices, rethink representation in media, and explore new media methods. For future @thedojoTV developments follow us online:

http://thedojotv.net/
IG: @thedojotv
FB: @thedojotv

☜♡☞ ☜♡☞ ☜♡☞ ☜♡☞ ☜♡☞ ☜♡☞ ☜♡☞ ☜♡☞ ☜♡☞ ☜♡☞ 

Remember The Dojo supports creating a safe space without nonsense.

The Dojo is an Safe Space which means NO harmful or oppressive behavior is welcome here. Harmful oroppressive behavior includes: Harrasment. Violence. Violation of Consent. Racism. Misogyny. Heteorsexism. Antagonism. Silencing. Intimidation. Coercion. Any violators will be asked to leave.

~there is no defeat in this dojo~

data.name: Grow-Op Community Garden Day feat. Bike Workshop
data.description:
Our WEEKLY community garden days are back EVERY SATURDAY!

Free food, family-friendly art and garden activities, food scrap drop-off, and different workshops every week. 

This month's featured workshop:
 "Sinema Obscura Cycle Studio" bicycle repair clinic. 
**stay tuned for a late summer film screening collab between Sinema Obscura & Hostel Earphoria**
--->https://www.facebook.com/SinemaObscura/

FOOD SCRAP DROP-OFF Notice:
If you're dropping off food scraps for our compost pile, we accept them between 10a-3p Saturday only. Please come through the side entrance and say hello! We are close to capacity in our pile, so if you have a lot of food waste, talk to us and we'll help you come up with a sustainable solution close to your home!
----------------------------------------

j o i n u s : 
(((((( at 3464 W. Diversey Ave )))))
_/\__/\__0>
~Every Tuesday from 3p-8p for garden volunteer work days
~Every Saturday from 10a-3p for community garden days and free compost drop-offs
~First Tuesday of every month for our Plant Tuesday meet-ups
_/\__/\__0> _/\__/\__0> _/\__/\__0>

We are volunteer run and funded on donations.
If you have donations (money, pots or trays, seeds, etc.) please bring it to our meetings / event days -or- donate online: 
www.growopchicago.org

Thank you for all of your support so far!

*************

data.name: Hostel Presents: Disco Pigs
data.description:
<<<<< D I S C O   P I G S >>>>>>
a two night theatrical production written by Enda Walsh and directed by Michael Rogerson hosted at Hostel Earphoria, an art collective and co-op in Logan Square.

TWO NIGHTS ONLY!!
----> Thursday, 3/22 //// Doors at 7:30p, start time at 8:30p
----> Saturday, 3/31 //// Doors at 8:30p, start time at 9:30p

The first of many future theatre productions to be hosted by the Hostel family. 

$5-$10 suggested donation ((ALL $$ goes to the performers))
BYOB

Respect the space and those around you :-) Anyone who violates the safety of the another at the event will be forced to leave.

Accessibility: Entrance through side gate avoids stairs and leads you directly to the performance space. Stairs are required to access bathroom.

:::::::::::::::::::::the story :::::::::::::::::::::::
Born at the same time on the same day in the same hospital, Pig and Runt have been inseparable ever since. They speak their own made-up language, play by their own rules, and have created an insular world in which boundaries blur between truth and make-believe. But encroaching adulthood calls for an end to their idyll. On their 17th birthdays, in a kind of last dance, they feverishly drink, fantasize, and try to hold onto the childhood that’s slipping through their fingers. An intense and surrealistic play about the fantastical shared worlds within friendships, and the exhilaration and terror of growing up.

This site-specific production reimagines Enda Walsh’s seminal play as a rock concert, complete with opening bands and an onstage drummer accompanying the entire performance.

data.name: Hostel Grow-Op Meet-Up no. 3 (MWUF Summit Prep)
data.description:
<<<happy P L A N T tuesday friends >>>
Ƹ̵̡Ӝ̵̨̄Ʒ      Ƹ̵̡Ӝ̵̨̄Ʒ        Ƹ̵̡Ӝ̵̨̄Ʒ       Ƹ̵̡Ӝ̵̨̄Ʒ       Ƹ̵̡Ӝ̵̨̄Ʒ         Ƹ̵̡Ӝ̵̨̄Ʒ
This monthly volunteer meeting theme: The Midwest Urban Farmer Summit! http://midwesturbanfarmers.org/

We're helping curate the MWFSummit this year behind the amazing leadership of Katie from Chicago Patchwork Farms :-)
This year it's at The Plant on March 10th and 11th, and is for production-based urban farmers of all experience levels to share information, ask questions, develop best practices, and learn how to run financially sustainable businesses. Meet farmers all over the midwest and participate in workshops, round table discussions, and the resource fair.

At this meet-up, Hostel plant mavens Manuel & GLADmatt will be working on some installations and making signs for the event. Wontcha join us? We're also seeking volunteers to help make/serve food and help day of the conference, so please reach out if you're interested! You'll be fed, watered, and receive a plant for your help ;-)

As for the Grow-Op, our season starts March 13th. We'll have some more updates for you at the meeting, but join us: 

_/\__/\__0>
~Every Tuesday from 3p-8p for garden volunteer work days
~Every Saturday from 10a-3p for community garden days and free compost drop-offs
~First Tuesday of every month for our planning meet-up
_/\__/\__0>         _/\__/\__0>              _/\__/\__0>

If you have donations (money, pots or trays, seeds, etc.) please bring it to our meeting -or- donate directly to our Patreon page: 
www.patreon.com/hostelgrowop.

Thank you for all of your support so far!

*************

data.name: Let's Talk: Exploring Masculinity
data.description:
Join us for our monthly men's discussion and support group. 

The purpose of this meet up is to share stories and reflect on issues of masculinity and gender. 

You're welcome here. This is a space for men, trans-men, male-presenting people, or anyone who feels like they've benefitted from male privilege. Bring questions or topics you'd like to speak on or propose to the group if you'd like.

Let's listen to each other, talk through our emotions, and eat some food. Bring a snack (potluck style)!

Ages: 16 and older. 
Location: 3464 W Diversey Ave
Eating: 6:30-7:30pm
Talking: 7:30-9:30pm

This is a dry event, which means there is no drinking or smoking allowed at Hostel Earphoria from 6pm-10pm.
